availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: Saint Louis, Saint Louis County, Missouri

body.p:
State of Missouri
County of St Louis } S.S.

I. Henry T Tomlinson duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky resident at St Louis in the State of Missouri do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully Execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky
Sworn & Subscribed before me this 27th day of May AD 1862 as witness my hand & official Seal the day and year last above written

E. D. Jones.
Notary Public St Louis Co Mo

figure.ab:
E. D. JONES
NOTARY
PUBLIC
SAINT LOUIS CO. MO.

body.p:
"Seal"
H. T. TOMLINSON.
A
COMMISSIONER
OF
DEEDS,
AT
ST. LOUIS, MISSOURI.

"Signature"
H. T. Tomlinson
Commissioner for Kentucky
in Missouri

Missouri
Oath of H. T. Tomlinson
Comr. of Deeds
Filed May 30.th 1862
